intro: Adenoropium spinosum, commonly known as the spiny adenoropium, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and small, leathery leaves. It produces clusters of white or pinkish flowers that bloom in the spring. Adenoropium spinosum is often found in rocky or well-drained soils in woodland or mountainous regions.
